data.Sentence: --- Lesson 85  Never too old to learn

data.Sentence_cn: 我刚刚收到母校的一封信，通知我说以前的校长斯图亚特.佩奇先生下星期就要退休了。
data.Sentence: I have just received a letter from my old school, informing me that my former headmaster, Mr. Stuart Page, will be retiring next week.

data.Sentence_cn: 为了纪念这个日子，学校的学生--无论老同学还是新同学--将送他一件礼物。
data.Sentence: Pupils of the school, old and new, will be sending him a present to mark the occasion.

data.Sentence_cn: 所有凑钱买此礼品的人都将自己的名字签在一本大签名簿上，签名簿将被送到校长的家里。
data.Sentence: All those who have contributed towards the gift will sign their names in a large album which will be sent to the headmaster's home.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们不会忘记佩奇先生对我们既有耐心又充满理解，也不会忘记在我们不愿去上学时他给予我们的亲切鼓励。
data.Sentence: We shall all remember Mr. Page for his patience and understanding and for the kindly encouragement he gave us when we went so unwillingly to school.

data.Sentence_cn: 很多老同学都准备参加下星期四为他举行的告别宴会。
data.Sentence: A great many former pupils will be attending a farewell dinner in his honour next Thursday.

data.Sentence_cn: 佩奇先生退休的前一天正好是他执教满40年的日子，这真是奇妙的巧合。
data.Sentence: It is a curious coincidence that the day before his retirement, Mr. Page will have been teaching for a total of forty years.

data.Sentence_cn: 他退休后，将致力于园艺。
data.Sentence: After he has retired, he will devote himself to gardening.

data.Sentence_cn: 对于他来说，这将是一种全新的爱好。
data.Sentence: For him, this will be an entirely new hobby.

data.Sentence_cn: 但这没有关系，因为正如他常说的那样，人要活到老学到老。
data.Sentence: But this does not matter, for, as he has often remarked, one is never too old to learn.
